sections.name: eye-tracking
sections.definition: Eye-tracking-template template schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.56

sections.name: in2pb-header
sections.definition: Header to be used for metadata templates created for In2PB projects.

properties.name: in2pb-header
properties.definition: Header to be used for metadata templates created for In2PB projects.

sections.name: eye-tracking-header
sections.definition: Header with instructions for the eye tracking metadata.

properties.name: eye-tracking-header
properties.definition: Header with instructions for the eye tracking metadata.

sections.name: eye-tracking-element
sections.definition: Metadata describing the eye tracking recordings.

properties.name: eyeDataSamplingFrequency
properties.definition: Sampling frequency of the eye tracking data in the recording in Hz.

properties.name: eyeDataSampleCoordinateUnit
properties.definition: Unit of individual samples. E.g., in pixel or metric (mm, cm) units.

properties.name: eyeDataSampleCoordinateSystem
properties.definition: For classical screen-based eye tracking like in the CL experiments, it will be “gaze-on-screen”, but “eye-in-head” or “gaze-in-world” are also possible coordinate systems (e.g. in VR)

properties.name: screenDistance
properties.definition: Distance between the participant's eye and the screen in centimeter.

properties.name: screenSizeWidth
properties.definition: Screen size width, excluding potential screen borders in centimeters.

properties.name: eyeDataEnvironmentCoordinates
properties.definition: In the case of the classical gaze-on-screen coordinates, this can be for example: [["0,0", "top left"], ["1,1", "bottom right"]]. In VR this could take on, amongst others, spherical coordinates.

properties.name: screenSizeHeight
properties.definition: Screen size heigth, excluding potential screen borders in centimeters.

properties.name: screenResolutionWidth
properties.definition: Resolution width in pixels.

properties.name: screenResolutionHeight
properties.definition: Resolution height in pixels.

properties.name: screenRefreshRate
properties.definition: Screen referesh rate in Hertz.

properties.name: recordedEye
properties.definition: Specification for which eye was tracked.Must be one of: "left", "right", "both".

properties.name: calibrationComment
properties.definition: Comment describing the calibration used associated with the eye-tracking recordings.

properties.name: calibrationType
properties.definition: Description of the calibration procedure. For example the "H3" for horizontal calibration with 3 positions or "HV9" for horizontal and vertical calibration with 9 positions, or one point calibration.

properties.name: calibrationPosition
properties.definition: Provide a list of X/Y coordinates in the calibrationUnit. For example, using 5 positions calibration presented on an HD screen, it could be [[960,50],[960,540],[960,1030],[50,540],[1870,540]].

properties.name: calibrationUnit
properties.definition: Unit of "calibrationPosition". Must be one of: "pixel", "mm", "cm".

properties.name: maximalCalibrationError
properties.definition: Maximal calibration error (default in visual degrees).

properties.name: averageCalibrationError
properties.definition: Average calibration error (default in visual degrees).

properties.name: calibrationErrorUnit
properties.definition: Unit used for calibration error. Default is visual degrees.

properties.name: eyeCameraSettings
properties.definition: A field to store any settings that influence the resolution and quality of the eye imagery.

properties.name: featureDetectionSettings
properties.definition: A field to store any settings that influence the feature detection.

properties.name: gazeMappingSettings
properties.definition: A field to store any settings that influence the gaze mapping.

properties.name: rawDataFilters
properties.definition: Filter settings applied to eye-movement raw data. For example Eyelink trackers typically automatically filter the raw data.

properties.name: screenAOIDefinition
properties.definition: A description of the shape of the Screen AOIs and what coordinates are used. ["square", ["x_start", "x_stop", "y_start", "y_stop"]] Other options: "custom"/"circle"/"triangle", [["x", "y"], ["x", "y"], ["x", "y"], and so on.]  Ignore if not applicable.

properties.name: pupilFitMethod
properties.definition: The method employed for fitting the pupil, for example "centre-of-mass" or "ellipse". If "centre-of-mass" or "ellipse" method is used, it is RECOMMENDED to use these exact labels.

sections.name: acquisiton-system-element
sections.definition: Information about the hardware and software of the data acquisition system.

properties.name: powerLineFrequency
properties.definition: Frequency (in Hz) of the power line at the setup location.

properties.name: manufacturer
properties.definition: Manufacturer of the acquisition system (e.g. "OpenEphys”, “Alphaomega",”Blackrock”)

properties.name: manufacturerModelName
properties.definition: Name of the data acquisition system used.

properties.name: manufacturerModelVersion
properties.definition: Version of the data acquisition system.

properties.name: recordingSetupCustomName
properties.definition: Custom name of the data acquisition system.

properties.name: institutionName
properties.definition: The name of the institution where data is recorded.

properties.name: institutionAddress
properties.definition: The address of the institution where data is recorded.

properties.name: samplingFrequency
properties.definition: Internal (maximum) sampling frequency of the recording in Hz.

properties.name: serialNumbers
properties.definition: The serial number of the components of the setup, recommended to add serial numbers and versions of ALL components constituting the setup.

properties.name: usesSoftwareSuite
properties.definition: Software suite used for data acquisition.

properties.name: softwareVersions
properties.definition: Version of the acquisition softwares.

properties.name: systemCreator
properties.definition: Name of the person(s) who set up the system.

properties.name: systemMaintainer
properties.definition: Name of the person(s) who maintains the system.

sections.name: free-text-field
sections.definition: A free text element to allow the user to provide any additional information.

properties.name: free-text-field
properties.definition: A free text element to allow the user to provide any additional information.
